enrl_requirement: Enrollment Requirements: Reserved for Anthropology majors and minors.
title: WCAS ANTHRO 390-0-25 Topics In Anthropology

descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value: Native Americans experience significant disparities in health and in access to health care. This course introduces students to Native American health by exploring the social, cultural, political, and environmental determinants influencing Native health both historically and today. This course is designed as a reading intensive, discussion-based seminar, drawing upon research and contributions from a variety of disciplines including American Indian studies, anthropology, history, psychology, public health, and medicine.

descriptions.name: Class Materials (Required)
descriptions.value:
(1) Life Beside Itself by Lisa Stevensen, ISBN 978-0520282940
(2) Diabetes Among the Pima by Carolyn Smith-Morris, ISBN 978-0816527328
(3) The Scalpel and the Silver Bear by Lori Alvord, ISBN 978-0553378009
(4) Disciplined Hearts by Theresa O'Nell, ISBN 978-0520214460

subject: ANTHRO
